723543f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 7th Avenue
723543f.text:
Broadway, (left) north from West 46th Street, and Seventh Ave.,
(right) north from the same point, showing a night view of the northern
end of the Times Square; the ''Great White Way,'' the worlds greatest
theatrical district.
About 1925.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723547f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 7th Avenue
723547f.text:
Times Squere, south from but not including West 46th Street, showing
W.P.A. employees removing the Seventh Ave., street car tracks. Broadway
(shown on the right) intersects at this point with Seventh Ave. Prominently
shown are Loews State Theatre; the Times Building and the Astor Hotel.
July 14, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

717514f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 45th Street
717514f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, at West 45th Street and southward, showing
prominently the Astor Theatre (No. 1531-1537 Broadway) at the N.W. corner
of same. Occupying the block fromt southward is the Hotel Astor. The
triangular edifice appearing on the left is the Times Building. This
area is popularly known as Times Scuare,though the buildings, on both
sides bear Broadway addresses. These two views, consisting of a negative
and a positive, comprise a set.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

713222f-a.title: Manhattan: 45th Street - 7th Avenue
713222f-a.text:
45th Street, north side, west from Depew Place. At the right may
be seen the beginning of construction work on the New York Central.
October 11,1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713233f-b.title: Manhattan: 45th Street (West) - Broadway
713233f-b.text:
West 45th Street, north side, west from a point midway between
Broadway and Eighth Ave. and to the latter, showing three theatres;
the Music Box (No. 239); the lmperial (No. 249) and the C.B.S. (No. 25L).
This set consists of a negative and a positive.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Faderal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

713232f.title: Manhattan: 45th Street (West) - Broadway
713232f.text:
West 45th Street, west from a point midway between Broadway and
Eighth Ave., and across the latter, showing several of the theatres that
line both sides of this street. Shown on the south side is the Booth,
the Plymouth and the Golden Theatres. Facing same on the opposite side
are the Music Box, Iperial and the C.B.S. (formerly the Avon) Theatres.
This set, consisting of three positive and three negative views, shows
several different portions of this Times Square theatre district.
November 29, 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

723531f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 7th Avenue
723531f-a.text:
Broadway, south from and including 43rd Street. At the right
of this view is Seventh Ave., south from and including 43rd Street.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
N., : 1363

723552f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 7th Avenue
723552f.text:

at the intersection of Broadway (left) and Seventh Ave., (right).
About 1905.
New York Edison Co.

723546f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 45th Street
723546f-b.text:
Times Square, north from West 45th Street, showing the theatrical
district of New York. The buildings on both sides of this open area
bear Broadway numbers; while north of 47th Street (center, apex), Seventh
Ave. regains its identity. This is a set of 2 views, No. 2 of which is
from the Seventh Ave. side.
September 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713230f-b.title: Manhattan: 45th Street (West) - Broadway
713230f-b.text:
West 45th Street, north side, west from (No. 149-157) a point ea
of Broadway and across same, showing prominently the Lyceum Theatre
No. 149-157; a structure adjoining the rear of Loew's State Theatre
has an entrance on Broadway, through the large office building at th
N.E. corner. The edifice partially shown on the left is the Hotel A
Westward on 45th Street and between Broadway and Eighth Ave. is the
Piccadilly. This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717515f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 45th Street (West)
717515f-b.text:
Broadway, west side, from West 45th to 46th Streets,
showing prominently the Astor at the N. W. corner. Thts
former legitimate theatre is now used for 'ew York premi-
ers of motion pictures. Playing at this date is ''Lloyds
of London.'' Above same is the Globe Theatre with a Min-
sky burlesque attraction. Subse uently the latter actf-
vtttes were curta'ied by the enforcement of the edioct
of the Commissioner of License, sliminating the use Sf
the word ''burlesque'' and the discontinuance of ''Strip
Tease'' Acts.
1937
Views 1,2
W. P. A.
Federal Writers Project
N. Y. C. Guide
CREDIT LINE IPERATIVE
